text: Olive Mary Bartle (1912-1994) was female swimmer who competed for England. ==Diving career== Bartle won a bronze medal in the 4×110 yard freestyle relay at the 1934 British Empire Games in London. Bartle was the southern counties 220 yards freestyle champion and represented England in the 1934 European Games in Magdeburg. She swam for the Kingston & Croydon Swimming Clubs. ==Personal life== She married Ralph Banfield in 1937. ==References== Category:1912 births Category:1994 deaths Category:English female swimmers Category:Swimmers at the 1934 British Empire Games Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in swimming Category:Commonwealth Games bronze medallists for England
title: Olive Bartle
